entry.title: MIT The Missing Semester of Your CS Education Lecture 2 - Shell tool and scripting
entry.content:
@ [toc]

MIT The Missing Semester of Your CS Education Lecture 2 - Shell tool and scripting

èµ‹å€¼

$ foo=hello
$ echo $foo
hello
  • å•å¼•å·ä¸åŒå¼•å·
    åŒå¼•å·ä¸­çš„å˜é‡ä¼šè¢«å±•å¼€
$ foo=hello
$ echo "$foo world"
hello world
$ echo '$foo world'
$foo world
  • å®šä¹‰å‡½æ•°
$ source a.sh

  • mkdir -p ( create a directory under the current directory)

  • ä¿ç•™å˜é‡
    $0: the name of the script
    1âˆ’9:thesecondthroughtthenintharguments1-9: the second throught the ninth arguments 1âˆ’9:thesecondthroughtthenintharguments?: get the value from the previous command
    :thelastargumentofthepreviouscommand_: the last argument of the previous command :â€‹thelastargumentofthepreviouscommand#:
    !!: the previous command

$ mkdir test
$ cd $_
  • grep ( search)
$ grep 1 a.cpp ( search a in the a.cpp)

  • è¿”å›å€¼
    0 : true
    1 : false

  • è¿ç®—ç¬¦
    &&, ||, ;

$ false || echo "oops fail"
oops fail
$ true || echo "will not be printed"
$ true && echo "it goes well"
it goes well
$ false && echo "will not be printed"
$ false ; echo "things always be printed"
things always be printed
  • å‘½ä»¤æ›¿æ¢: $( )
$ foo=$(pwd)
$ echo "We are in the $(pwd)"
  • è¿‡ç¨‹æ›¿æ¢: <() å°†()å†…å®¹è¾“å…¥æ–‡ä»¶
$ echo <(ls) <(ls ..)

entry.title: MIT The Missing Semester of Your CS Education Lecture 1 - Shell
entry.content:
• MIT The Missing Semester of Your CS Education Lecture 1
    • what is shell
    • bash

MIT The Missing Semester of Your CS Education Lecture 1

shell

what is shell

å‘½ä»¤è¡Œå·¥å…·ï¼ŒåŸºäºæ–‡æœ¬å·¥å…·
windows: powershell
linux: bash ( bourne again shellï¼‰

bash

å‘½ä»¤è¡Œæç¤ºç¬¦ ( shell prompt)

  • date ( date and time)

å¸¦å‚æ•° ( arguments) æ‰§è¡Œç¨‹åº

  • echo ( print the arguments you give it)
$ echo hello
hello

å‚æ•°éœ€è¦ç©ºæ ¼ ( white space)åˆ†å¼€
å­—ç¬¦ä¸²ç”¨"" or ''
å•è½¬ä¹‰ç”¨\

$ echo "hello world"
hello world
$ echo hello\ world
hello world
  • mkdir ( make directory)

å†…åµŒç¨‹åºä½äºç³»ç»Ÿæ–‡ä»¶ ( system file)
æœç´¢å€ŸåŠ©ç¯å¢ƒå˜é‡ ( environment variable)ä¸­ PATHå˜é‡ ( PATH variable)

$ echo $PATH
  • which ( to find which it actully runs)
$ which echo

PATH:
linux/macos: /
under root/
windows:
one root for every partition
absolute path/ relative path

  • pwd ( print working directory)
$ pwd
  • cd ( change directory)
$ cd /home
  • . ( the current directory)
  • .. ( the parent directory)

write a program please give a absolute pathğŸ˜€

è¿è¡Œç¨‹åºé»˜è®¤å½“å‰ç›®å½•

  • ls ( list the files in the current directory)
$ ls
  • ~ ( direct to the home directory)
  • cd - ( cd the dirctory you were previously in)

ç¨‹åºæœ‰æ ‡å¿— ( flag)å’Œé€‰é¡¹ ( option)ä½œä¸ºå‚æ•°ï¼Œä»¥-å¼€å¤´

  • --help
$ ls --help
  • -l ( give you more information)
$ ls -l

ls -lçš„åˆ—è¡¨ï¼š
3ä¸ªå­—æ¯ä¸€ç»„
å½“å‰ç”¨æˆ·æƒé™ | å½“å‰ç”¨æˆ·ç»„æƒé™ | å…¶ä»–äººæƒé™
read | write | execute
for flie: read ( read it), write ( save, add more, replace), execute ( run it)
for directory: read( list for the directory), write ( rename, create, remove file), execute( enter the dierctory)
(detele flie need the write for the directory)

  • mv ( rename file) ( change or move)
$ mv a.cpp b.cpp
$ mv a.cpp /b.cpp
  • cp ( copy)
$ cp a.cpp /b.cpp
  • rm ( remove) ( can not remove directory)
$ rm a.cpp
$ rm -r /dir ( to remove all files under the directory)
  • rmdir ( remove empty directory)
$ rmdir /dir
  • mkdir ( create a directory)
$ mkdir /a

  • crtl+c ( cancel)

  • man ( manul pages) (æŒ‰qé€€å‡º)

$ man ls
  • ctrl+l ( æ¸…ç©ºç»ˆç«¯)

æµ: < in > out >> add

$ echo hello > hello.out
  • cat ( show the file)
$ cat hello.in
$ cat < hello.in > hello.out
$ cat hello.out
$ cat <hello,in >> hello.out
$ cat hello.out
  • pipe:| ( take the output of the left program to and make the input of the right program)
$ a | b
  • tail ( print the last line)
$ tail -n1 ( print the last one line)

$ ls -l / | tail -n1> ls.txt
  • sudo ( super user: root)
  • sysfs ()
$ cd /sys

$ sudo su ( use root to run shell)
# ...
  • tee ( write to the file and shell)
$ tee < hello > hello.out

$ echo 500 | sudo tee brightness

  • xdg-open ( use right sofrware to open a file)

  • touch ( change the time of the file) ( usually use it to create a new file)

$ touch a.cpp
  • chmod ( change the permission)
u - user
g - group
o - other
+/-
rwx

$ chmod ug+rw a.cpp

entry.title: Hello Gridea
entry.content:
ğŸ‘ æ¬¢è¿ä½¿ç”¨ Gridea ï¼
âœï¸ Gridea ä¸€ä¸ªé™æ€åšå®¢å†™ä½œå®¢æˆ·ç«¯ã€‚ä½ å¯ä»¥ç”¨å®ƒæ¥è®°å½•ä½ çš„ç”Ÿæ´»ã€å¿ƒæƒ…ã€çŸ¥è¯†ã€ç¬”è®°ã€åˆ›æ„... ...

Github
Gridea ä¸»é¡µ
ç¤ºä¾‹ç½‘ç«™

ç‰¹æ€§ğŸ‘‡

ğŸ“ ä½ å¯ä»¥ä½¿ç”¨æœ€é…·çš„ Markdown è¯­æ³•ï¼Œè¿›è¡Œå¿«é€Ÿåˆ›ä½œ

ğŸŒ‰ ä½ å¯ä»¥ç»™æ–‡ç« é…ä¸Šç²¾ç¾çš„å°é¢å›¾å’Œåœ¨æ–‡ç« ä»»æ„ä½ç½®æ’å…¥å›¾ç‰‡

ğŸ·ï¸ ä½ å¯ä»¥å¯¹æ–‡ç« è¿›è¡Œæ ‡ç­¾åˆ†ç»„

ğŸ“‹ ä½ å¯ä»¥è‡ªå®šä¹‰èœå•ï¼Œç”šè‡³å¯ä»¥åˆ›å»ºå¤–éƒ¨é“¾æ¥èœå•

ğŸ’» ä½ å¯ä»¥åœ¨ Windowsï¼ŒMacOS æˆ– Linux è®¾å¤‡ä¸Šä½¿ç”¨æ­¤å®¢æˆ·ç«¯

ğŸŒ ä½ å¯ä»¥ä½¿ç”¨ ğ–¦ğ—‚ğ—ğ—ğ—ğ–» ğ–¯ğ–ºğ—€ğ–¾ğ—Œ æˆ– Coding Pages å‘ä¸–ç•Œå±•ç¤ºï¼Œæœªæ¥å°†æ”¯æŒæ›´å¤šå¹³å°

ğŸ’¬ ä½ å¯ä»¥è¿›è¡Œç®€å•çš„é…ç½®ï¼Œæ¥å…¥ Gitalk æˆ– DisqusJS è¯„è®ºç³»ç»Ÿ

ğŸ‡¬ğŸ‡§ ä½ å¯ä»¥ä½¿ç”¨ä¸­æ–‡ç®€ä½“æˆ–è‹±è¯­

ğŸŒ ä½ å¯ä»¥ä»»æ„ä½¿ç”¨åº”ç”¨å†…é»˜è®¤ä¸»é¢˜æˆ–ä»»æ„ç¬¬ä¸‰æ–¹ä¸»é¢˜ï¼Œå¼ºå¤§çš„ä¸»é¢˜è‡ªå®šä¹‰èƒ½åŠ›

ğŸ–¥ ä½ å¯ä»¥è‡ªå®šä¹‰æºæ–‡ä»¶å¤¹ï¼Œåˆ©ç”¨ OneDriveã€ç™¾åº¦ç½‘ç›˜ã€iCloudã€Dropbox ç­‰è¿›è¡Œå¤šè®¾å¤‡åŒæ­¥

ğŸŒ± å½“ç„¶ Gridea è¿˜å¾ˆå¹´è½»ï¼Œæœ‰å¾ˆå¤šä¸è¶³ï¼Œä½†è¯·ç›¸ä¿¡ï¼Œå®ƒä¼šä¸åœå‘å‰ ğŸƒ

æœªæ¥ï¼Œå®ƒä¸€å®šä¼šæˆä¸ºä½ ç¦»ä¸å¼€çš„ä¼™ä¼´

å°½æƒ…å‘æŒ¥ä½ çš„æ‰åå§ï¼
